Paragraph: Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| highest PCE |
| of μmR - polymer |
| based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) |
| using complicated doubled active layers |
| photovoltaic devices |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| highest PCE of μmR - polymer |
| based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) |
| using complicated doubled active layers |

Note: "highest PCE" is the property name, as it refers to the maximum power conversion efficiency of the μmR polymer. "Of μmR - polymer" and "based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine)" describe the material to which the property applies. "Using complicated doubled active layers" describes the method or process used to achieve the property value, but it is not a property itself.
